item.title: Plans for Summer!
item.description: What a way to end the school year, or I guess, way to start the year. This spring semester has been rather hectic, as everyone is aware of what has gone on. However, despite this tricky semester we’ve had at University, I’ve been able to hold steady and keep learning through challenging circumstances. Remote learning is fun at first, but it’s not great nor easy long term. Scheduling time to finish assignments as well as study while sitting at the same desk in the same room almost every hour for every day wears you out.

item.title: I'm not dead!
item.description: So I’ve been absent from updating my website as of late. The biggest issue concerning this was that I had upgraded from a 2011 MacBook Pro, to a 2015 MacBook Pro. Sidenote: I’d be willing to debate this, but the 2015 MacBook Pro was the last “great” MacBook Whilst doing this, I ended up committing the grave sin that all people do at some point or another- I never backed up the GoHugo site-generator source code.

item.title: Changing Themes
item.description: Sorry for it over a month, and while I’ve been busy, my perfectionist attitude with my website has made me again and again recreate the site to my specific desires for a pleasing, and simple blog. Now, that I’ve finally been able to complete my work of changing the theme, and figuring out after a few painstaking days of how to create, add, and display my posts, the shared trip of my life, knowledge, and experiences can be shared amongst you wonderful readers.

item.title: Hello World
item.description: Well, for a Hello World! post, this seems pretty boring. However, I’m much more pleased with this than my previous attempt to use Jekyll for local hosting to test, and build my site. Hugo has been a much easier start, and has a simpler methodology to building the site. While I’m not an expert by any means in HTML, or CSS, this attractive base theme certainly has its uses in making a good foundation for me to modify and create something.

item.title: About
item.description: I’m a Computer Science student that attends the University of Missouri - Kansas City, in Kansas City, Missouri. I like to spend my time reading, working on projects, or tinkering with my electronics, and vehicle.

item.title: My Resume
item.description: GOALS Acquire experience in a challenging and interesting environment, with a focus on learning new technologies and skills. SKILLS & ABILITIES • C++ • C# • Java • Python • Maintain and Troubleshoot OS X, Linux, and Windows Assembled numerous home systems. EXPERIENCE Park Hill School District: November 2018 – Present Technology Support Assistant for Lakeview Middle School, and District Office • Maintain fleet of One-to-One devices for Students and Faculty.
